DOCNAME: CASE OF VITTORIO AND LUIGI MANCINI v. ITALY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL armed robberies were committed in the GPE area . It emerges from a report prepared by the GPE police on DATE that there was evidence that the stolen goods had been hidden in a warehouse belonging to the company owned by the applicants . The latter were also said to have been in telephone contact with persons suspected of the offences .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor applied for the applicants to be placed in pre - trial detention . In an order of DATE , the GPE investigating judge allowed that application .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were arrested and taken to FAC . On DATE they appealed against the order of CARDINAL DATE to the division of ORG responsible for reconsidering security measures ( tribunale del riesame ) .

CARDINAL . The hearing before ORG was held on DATE . In an order delivered the same day , filed with the registry on DATE , the court replaced the applicants’ pre - trial detention with the security measure of house arrest ( arresti domiciliari ) . It considered , in particular , that it was reasonable to suspect that the applicants had committed the offences in issue and that it was to be feared that they might commit others of the same type . Taking the view , however , that there was no “ tangible risk for the gathering of evidence ” and having regard to the GPE clean police record , it concluded that a less restrictive measure , such as house arrest , was preferable . That measure required the applicants to stay in their home and leave only with the authorities’ prior authorisation .

CARDINAL . NORP The order of DATE was served on the applicants on DATE . They should therefore have been immediately escorted from FAC , where they were being held , to their home . However , no police officers were available to escort them and so their transfer was delayed until DATE .
